text: Adam, Seth, Enosh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,
speaker: Narrator

text: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,
speaker: Narrator

text: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Diphath, and Togarmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cush became the father of Nimrod. He began to be a mighty one in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mizraim became the father of Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Pathrusim, Casluhim (where the Philistines came from), and Caphtorim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Canaan became the father of Sidon his firstborn, Heth,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Jebusite, the Amorite, the Girgashite,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Hivite, the Arkite, the Sinite,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Arvadite, the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arpachshad became the father of Shelah, and Shelah became the father of Eber.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided; and his brother’s name was Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shem, Arpachshad, Shelah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
speaker: Narrator

text: Serug, Nahor, Terah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abram (also called Abraham).
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are their generations: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth; then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: she bore Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the sons of Keturah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham became the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and Amalek.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam; and Timna was Lotan’s sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shobal: Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Anah: Dishon. The sons of Dishon: Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Jaakan. The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom, before any king reigned over the children of Israel: Bela the son of Beor; and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bela died, and Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jobab died, and Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad, who struck Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his place; and the name of his city was Avith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Samlah died, and Shaul of Rehoboth by the River reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shaul died, and Baal Hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Baal Hanan died, and Hadad reigned in his place; and the name of his city was Pai. His wife’s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Hadad died. The chiefs of Edom were: chief Timna, chief Aliah, chief Jetheth,
speaker: Narrator

text: chief Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,
speaker: Narrator

text: chief Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar,
speaker: Narrator

text: chief Magdiel, and chief Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, and Shelah, which three were born to him of Shua’s daughter the Canaanitess. Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in Yahweh’s sight; and he killed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tamar his daughter-in-law bore him Perez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara—five of them in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Carmi: Achar, the troubler of Israel, who committed a trespass in the devoted thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Ethan: Azariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons also of Hezron, who were born to him: Jerahmeel, Ram, and Chelubai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ram became the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, prince of the children of Judah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Nahshon became the father of Salma, and Salma became the father of Boaz,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Boaz became the father of Obed, and Obed became the father of Jesse;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jesse became the father of his firstborn Eliab, Abinadab the second, Shimea the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ozem the sixth, and David the seventh;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The sons of Zeruiah: Abishai, Joab, and Asahel, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abigail bore Amasa; and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Caleb the son of Hezron became the father of children by Azubah his wife, and by Jerioth; and these were her sons: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azubah died, and Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hur became the father of Uri, and Uri became the father of Bezalel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he took as wife when he was sixty years old; and she bore him Segub.
speaker: Narrator

text: Segub became the father of Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Geshur and Aram took the towns of Jair from them, with Kenath, and its villages, even sixty cities. All these were the sons of Machir the father of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Hezron died in Caleb Ephrathah, Abijah, Hezron’s wife, bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron were Ram the firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah. She was the mother of Onam.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel were Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail; and she bore him Ahban and Molid.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim; but Seled died without children.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Appaim: Ishi. The son of Ishi: Sheshan. The son of Sheshan: Ahlai.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jada the brother of Shammai: Jether and Jonathan; and Jether died without children.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Sheshan had no sons, but only daughters. Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name was Jarha.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant as wife; and she bore him Attai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Attai became the father of Nathan, and Nathan became the father of Zabad,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zabad became the father of Ephlal, and Ephlal became the father of Obed,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Obed became the father of Jehu, and Jehu became the father of Azariah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azariah became the father of Helez, and Helez became the father of Eleasah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Eleasah became the father of Sismai, and Sismai became the father of Shallum,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Shallum became the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah became the father of Elishama.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel were Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hebron: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shema became the father of Raham, the father of Jorkeam; and Rekem became the father of Shammai.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Shammai was Maon; and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Haran, Moza, and Gazez; and Haran became the father of Gazez.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jahdai: Regem, Jothan, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Maacah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.
speaker: Narrator

text: She bore also Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbena and the father of Gibea; and the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Caleb, the son of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth Gader.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim had sons: Haroeh, half of the Menuhoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The families of Kiriath Jearim: the Ithrites, the Puthites, the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; from them came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Salma: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, and half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The families of scribes who lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and the Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these were the sons of David, who were born to him in Hebron: the firstborn, Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second, Daniel, of Abigail the Carmelitess;
speaker: Narrator

text: the third, Absalom the son of Maacah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifth, Shephatiah of Abital; the sixth, Ithream by Eglah his wife:
speaker: Narrator

text: six were born to him in Hebron; and he reigned there seven years and six months. He reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem;
speaker: Narrator

text: and these were born to him in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon, four, by Bathshua the daughter of Ammiel;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were the sons of David, in addition to the sons of the concubines; and Tamar was their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon’s son was Rehoboam, Abijah his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Amon his son, and Josiah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Josiah: the firstborn Johanan, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, and the fourth Shallum.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jehoiakim: Jeconiah his son, and Zedekiah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jeconiah, the captive: Shealtiel his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Pedaiah: Zerubbabel and Shimei. The sons of Zerubbabel: Meshullam and Hananiah; and Shelomith was their sister;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab Hesed, five.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hananiah: Pelatiah and Jeshaiah; the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sons of Shecaniah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Shecaniah: Shemaiah. The sons of Shemaiah: Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat, six.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Neariah: Elioenai, Hizkiah, and Azrikam, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani, seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reaiah the son of Shobal became the father of Jahath; and Jahath became the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These are the families of the Zorathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of the father of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash. The name of their sister was Hazzelelponi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Penuel was the father of Gedor and Ezer the father of Hushah. These are the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, the father of Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Helah were Zereth, Izhar, and Ethnan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hakkoz became the father of Anub, Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jabez was more honorable than his brothers. His mother named him Jabez, saying, “Because I bore him with sorrow.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, “Oh that you would bless me indeed, and enlarge my border! May your hand be with me, and may you keep me from evil, that I may not cause pain!”
God granted him that which he requested.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chelub the brother of Shuhah became the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eshton became the father of Beth Rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Ir Nahash. These are the men of Recah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kenaz: Othniel and Seraiah. The sons of Othniel: Hathath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meonothai became the father of Ophrah: and Seraiah became the father of Joab the father of Ge Harashim, for they were craftsmen.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah, and Naam. The son of Elah: Kenaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jehallelel: Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ezrah: Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon; and Mered’s wife bore Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
speaker: Narrator

text: His wife the Jewess bore Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. These are the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of the wife of Hodiah, the sister of Naham, were the fathers of Keilah the Garmite and Eshtemoa the Maacathite.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shimon: Amnon, Rinnah, Ben Hanan, and Tilon. The sons of Ishi: Zoheth, and Ben Zoheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shelah the son of Judah: Er the father of Lecah, Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the house of those who worked fine linen, of the house of Ashbea;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jokim, and the men of Cozeba, and Joash, and Saraph, who had dominion in Moab, and Jashubilehem. These records are ancient.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the potters, and the inhabitants of Netaim and Gederah; they lived there with the king for his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Simeon: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul;
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, and Mishma his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Mishma: Hammuel his son, Zaccur his son, Shimei his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brothers didn’t have many children, and all their family didn’t multiply like the children of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They lived at Beersheba, Moladah, Hazarshual,
speaker: Narrator

text: at Bilhah, at Ezem, at Tolad,
speaker: Narrator

text: at Bethuel, at Hormah, at Ziklag,
speaker: Narrator

text: at Beth Marcaboth, Hazar Susim, at Beth Biri, and at Shaaraim. These were their cities until David’s reign.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, and Ashan, five cities;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all their villages that were around the same cities, as far as Baal. These were their settlements, and they kept their genealogy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah the son of Amaziah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel, Jehu the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah—
speaker: Narrator

text: these mentioned by name were princes in their families. Their fathers’ houses increased greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went to the entrance of Gedor, even to the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: They found rich, good pasture, and the land was wide, and quiet, and peaceful, for those who lived there before were descended from Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text: These written by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and struck their tents and the Meunim who were found there; and they destroyed them utterly to this day, and lived in their place, because there was pasture there for their flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of them, even of the sons of Simeon, five hundred men, went to Mount Seir, having for their captains Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.
speaker: Narrator

text: They struck the remnant of the Amalekites who escaped, and have lived there to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (for he was the firstborn, but because he defiled his father’s couch, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph the son of Israel; and the genealogy is not to be listed according to the birthright.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Judah prevailed above his brothers, and from him came the prince; but the birthright was Joseph’s)—
speaker: Narrator

text: the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Beerah his son, whom Tilgath Pilneser king of Assyria carried away captive. He was prince of the Reubenites.
speaker: Narrator

text: His brothers by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was listed: the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who lived in Aroer, even to Nebo and Baal Meon;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he lived eastward even to the entrance of the wilderness from the river Euphrates, because their livestock were multiplied in the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the days of Saul, they made war with the Hagrites, who fell by their hand; and they lived in their tents throughout all the land east of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gad lived beside them in the land of Bashan to Salecah:
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel the chief, Shapham the second, Janai, and Shaphat in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their brothers of their fathers’ houses: Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Eber, seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Abihail, the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, chief of their fathers’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They lived in Gilead in Bashan and in its towns, and in all the pasture lands of Sharon as far as their borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were listed by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuben, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, of valiant men, men able to bear buckler and sword, able to shoot with bow, and skillful in war, were forty-four thousand seven hundred sixty that were able to go out to war.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made war with the Hagrites, with Jetur, and Naphish, and Nodab.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were helped against them, and the Hagrites were delivered into their hand, and all who were with them; for they cried to God in the battle, and he answered them because they put their trust in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took away their livestock: of their camels fifty thousand, and of sheep two hundred fifty thousand, and of donkeys two thousand, and of men one hundred thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many fell slain, because the war was of God. They lived in their place until the captivity.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of the half-tribe of Manasseh lived in the land. They increased from Bashan to Baal Hermon, Senir, and Mount Hermon.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the heads of their fathers’ houses: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel—mighty men of valor, famous men, heads of their fathers’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They trespassed against the God of their fathers, and played the prostitute after the gods of the peoples of the land whom God destroyed before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, and the spirit of Tilgath Pilneser king of Assyria, and he carried away the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, and brought them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and to the river of Gozan, to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Amram: Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar became the father of Phinehas, Phinehas became the father of Abishua,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishua became the father of Bukki. Bukki became the father of Uzzi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzzi became the father of Zerahiah. Zerahiah became the father of Meraioth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meraioth became the father of Amariah. Amariah became the father of Ahitub.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahitub became the father of Zadok. Zadok became the father of Ahimaaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahimaaz became the father of Azariah. Azariah became the father of Johanan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Johanan became the father of Azariah, who executed the priest’s office in the house that Solomon built in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah became the father of Amariah. Amariah became the father of Ahitub.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahitub became the father of Zadok. Zadok became the father of Shallum.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum became the father of Hilkiah. Hilkiah became the father of Azariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah became the father of Seraiah. Seraiah became the father of Jehozadak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehozadak went into captivity when Yahweh carried Judah and Jerusalem away by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the sons of Gershom: Libni and Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Gershom: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, and Jeatherai his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath: Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elkanah: Amasai and Ahimoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for Elkanah, the sons of Elkanah: Zophai his son, Nahath his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, and Elkanah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Samuel: the firstborn, Joel, and the second, Abijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari: Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, Asaiah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are they whom David set over the service of song in Yahweh’s house after the ark came to rest there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They ministered with song before the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting until Solomon had built Yahweh’s house in Jerusalem. They performed the duties of their office according to their order.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are those who served, and their sons. Of the sons of the Kohathites: Heman the singer, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: His brother Asaph, who stood on his right hand, even Asaph the son of Berechiah, the son of Shimea,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the left hand their brothers the sons of Merari: Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their brothers the Levites were appointed for all the service of the tabernacle of God’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Aaron and his sons offered on the altar of burnt offering, and on the altar of incense, for all the work of the most holy place, and to make atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zadok his son, and Ahimaaz his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are their dwelling places according to their encampments in their borders: to the sons of Aaron, of the families of the Kohathites (for theirs was the first lot),
speaker: Narrator

text: to them they gave Hebron in the land of Judah, and its pasture lands around it;
speaker: Narrator

text: but the fields of the city and its villages, they gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the sons of Aaron they gave the cities of refuge, Hebron, Libnah also with its pasture lands, Jattir, Eshtemoa with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hilen with its pasture lands, Debir with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashan with its pasture lands, and Beth Shemesh with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and out of the tribe of Benjamin, Geba with its pasture lands, Allemeth with its pasture lands, and Anathoth with its pasture lands. All their cities throughout their families were thirteen cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the rest of the sons of Kohath were given by lot, out of the family of the tribe, out of the half-tribe, the half of Manasseh, ten cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the sons of Gershom, according to their families, out of the tribe of Issachar, and out of the tribe of Asher, and out of the tribe of Naphtali, and out of the tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the sons of Merari were given by lot, according to their families, out of the tribe of Reuben, and out of the tribe of Gad, and out of the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Israel gave to the Levites the cities with their pasture lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave by lot out of the tribe of the children of Judah, and out of the tribe of the children of Simeon, and out of the tribe of the children of Benjamin, these cities which are mentioned by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the families of the sons of Kohath had cities of their borders out of the tribe of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave to them the cities of refuge, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim with its pasture lands and Gezer with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jokmeam with its pasture lands, Beth Horon with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Aijalon with its pasture lands, Gath Rimmon with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and out of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Aner with its pasture lands, and Bileam with its pasture lands, for the rest of the family of the sons of Kohath.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the sons of Gershom were given, out of the family of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Golan in Bashan with its pasture lands, and Ashtaroth with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and out of the tribe of Issachar, Kedesh with its pasture lands, Daberath with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ramoth with its pasture lands, and Anem with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and out of the tribe of Asher, Mashal with its pasture lands, Abdon with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hukok with its pasture lands, and Rehob with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and out of the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee with its pasture lands, Hammon with its pasture lands, and Kiriathaim with its pasture lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the rest of the Levites, the sons of Merari, were given, out of the tribe of Zebulun, Rimmono with its pasture lands, and Tabor with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and beyond the Jordan at Jericho, on the east side of the Jordan, were given them out of the tribe of Reuben: Bezer in the wilderness with its pasture lands, Jahzah with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedemoth with its pasture lands, and Mephaath with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and out of the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead with its pasture lands, Mahanaim with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Heshbon with its pasture lands, and Jazer with its pasture lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Issachar: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron, four.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Tola: Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their fathers’ houses, of Tola; mighty men of valor in their generations. Their number in the days of David was twenty-two thousand six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Uzzi: Izrahiah. The sons of Izrahiah: Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Isshiah, five; all of them chief men.
speaker: Narrator

text: With them, by their generations, after their fathers’ houses, were bands of the army for war, thirty-six thousand; for they had many wives and sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their brothers among all the families of Issachar, mighty men of valor, listed in all by genealogy, were eighty-seven thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Benjamin: Bela, Becher, and Jediael, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Bela: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri, five; heads of fathers’ houses, mighty men of valor; and they were listed by genealogy twenty-two thousand thirty-four.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Becher: Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these were the sons of Becher.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were listed by genealogy, after their generations, heads of their fathers’ houses, mighty men of valor, twenty thousand two hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Jediael: Bilhan. The sons of Bilhan: Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were sons of Jediael, according to the heads of their fathers’ households, mighty men of valor, seventeen thousand two hundred, who were able to go out in the army for war.
speaker: Narrator

text: So were Shuppim, Huppim, the sons of Ir, Hushim, and the sons of Aher.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Naphtali: Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, Shallum, and the sons of Bilhah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Manasseh: Asriel, whom his concubine the Aramitess bore. She bore Machir the father of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Machir took a wife of Huppim and Shuppim, whose sister’s name was Maacah. The name of the second was Zelophehad; and Zelophehad had daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Maacah the wife of Machir bore a son, and she named him Peresh. The name of his brother was Sheresh; and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ulam: Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: His sister Hammolecheth bore Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ephraim: Shuthelah, Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eleadah his son, Tahath his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zabad his son, Shuthelah his son, Ezer, and Elead, whom the men of Gath who were born in the land killed, because they came down to take away their livestock.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brothers came to comfort him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He went in to his wife, and she conceived and bore a son, and he named him Beriah, because there was trouble with his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: His daughter was Sheerah, who built Beth Horon the lower and the upper, and Uzzen Sheerah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rephah was his son, Resheph his son, Telah his son, Tahan his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ladan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nun his son, and Joshua his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their possessions and settlements were Bethel and its towns, and eastward Naaran, and westward Gezer with its towns; Shechem also and its towns, to Azzah and its towns;
speaker: Narrator

text: and by the borders of the children of Manasseh, Beth Shean and its towns, Taanach and its towns, Megiddo and its towns, and Dor and its towns. The children of Joseph the son of Israel lived in these.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah. Serah was their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Beriah: Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heber became the father of Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and Shua their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Japhlet: Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These are the children of Japhlet.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shemer: Ahi, Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Helem his brother: Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Zophah: Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jether: Jephunneh, Pispa, and Ara.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ulla: Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were the children of Asher, heads of the fathers’ houses, choice and mighty men of valor, chief of the princes. The number of them listed by genealogy for service in war was twenty-six thousand men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benjamin became the father of Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, Aharah the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bela had sons: Addar, Gera, Abihud,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Ehud. These are the heads of fathers’ households of the inhabitants of Geba, who were carried captive to Manahath:
speaker: Narrator

text: Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera, who carried them captive; and he became the father of Uzza and Ahihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shaharaim became the father of children in the field of Moab, after he had sent them away. Hushim and Baara were his wives.
speaker: Narrator

text: By Hodesh his wife, he became the father of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeuz, Shachia, and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: By Hushim, he became the father of Abitub and Elpaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elpaal: Eber, Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod, with its towns;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Beriah and Shema, who were heads of fathers’ households of the inhabitants of Aijalon, who put to flight the inhabitants of Gath;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,
speaker: Narrator

text: Michael, Ishpah, Joha, the sons of Beriah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishmerai, Izliah, Jobab, the sons of Elpaal,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adaiah, Beraiah, Shimrath, the sons of Shimei,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abdon, Zichri, Hanan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Iphdeiah, Penuel, the sons of Shashak,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jaareshiah, Elijah, Zichri, and the sons of Jeroham.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were heads of fathers’ households throughout their generations, chief men. These lived in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: The father of Gibeon, whose wife’s name was Maacah, lived in Gibeon
speaker: Narrator

text: with his firstborn son Abdon, Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gedor, Ahio, Zecher,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mikloth, who became the father of Shimeah. They also lived with their families in Jerusalem, near their relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ner became the father of Kish. Kish became the father of Saul. Saul became the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Jonathan was Merib-baal. Merib-baal became the father of Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Tarea, and Ahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz became the father of Jehoaddah. Jehoaddah became the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri became the father of Moza.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moza became the father of Binea. Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azel had six sons, whose names are these: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Eshek his brother: Ulam his firstborn, Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ulam were mighty men of valor, archers, and had many sons, and grandsons, one hundred fifty. All these were of the sons of Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all Israel were listed by genealogies; and behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel. Judah was carried away captive to Babylon for their disobedience.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the first inhabitants who lived in their possessions in their cities were Israel, the priests, the Levites, and the temple servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Jerusalem, there lived of the children of Judah, of the children of Benjamin, and of the children of Ephraim and Manasseh:
speaker: Narrator

text: Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, of the children of Perez the son of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Shilonites: Asaiah the firstborn and his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Zerah: Jeuel and their brothers, six hundred ninety.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Benjamin: Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ibneiah the son of Jeroham, and Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri; and Meshullam the son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their brothers, according to their generations, nine hundred fifty-six. All these men were heads of fathers’ households by their fathers’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the priests: Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jachin,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the ruler of God’s house;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malchijah; and Maasai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their brothers, heads of their fathers’ houses, one thousand seven hundred sixty; they were very able men for the work of the service of God’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Levites: Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Mica, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun; and Berechiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gatekeepers: Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their brothers (Shallum was the chief),
speaker: Narrator

text: who previously served in the king’s gate eastward. They were the gatekeepers for the camp of the children of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum was the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his brothers, of his father’s house, the Korahites, were over the work of the service, keepers of the thresholds of the tent. Their fathers had been over Yahweh’s camp, keepers of the entry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Phinehas the son of Eleazar was ruler over them in time past, and Yahweh was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was gatekeeper of the door of the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these who were chosen to be gatekeepers in the thresholds were two hundred twelve. These were listed by genealogy in their villages, whom David and Samuel the seer ordained in their office of trust.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they and their children had the oversight of the gates of Yahweh’s house, even the house of the tent, as guards.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the four sides were the gatekeepers, toward the east, west, north, and south.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their brothers, in their villages, were to come in every seven days from time to time to be with them,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the four chief gatekeepers, who were Levites, were in an office of trust, and were over the rooms and over the treasuries in God’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stayed around God’s house, because that was their duty; and it was their duty to open it morning by morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Certain of them were in charge of the vessels of service, for these were brought in by count, and these were taken out by count.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of them also were appointed over the furniture, and over all the vessels of the sanctuary, over the fine flour, the wine, the oil, the frankincense, and the spices.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the sons of the priests prepared the mixing of the spices.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, had the office of trust over the things that were baked in pans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of their brothers, of the sons of the Kohathites, were over the show bread, to prepare it every Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the singers, heads of fathers’ households of the Levites, who lived in the rooms and were free from other service, for they were employed in their work day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were heads of fathers’ households of the Levites, throughout their generations, chief men. They lived at Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeiel the father of Gibeon, whose wife’s name was Maacah, lived in Gibeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: His firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mikloth became the father of Shimeam. They also lived with their relatives in Jerusalem, near their relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ner became the father of Kish. Kish became the father of Saul. Saul became the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Jonathan was Merib-baal. Merib-baal became the father of Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz became the father of Jarah. Jarah became the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri became the father of Moza.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moza became the father of Binea, Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azel had six sons, whose names are Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Philistines fought against Israel; and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain on Mount Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Philistines followed hard after Saul and after his sons; and the Philistines killed Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua, the sons of Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The battle went hard against Saul, and the archers overtook him; and he was distressed by reason of the archers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Saul said to his armor bearer, “Draw your sword, and thrust me through with it, lest these uncircumcised come and abuse me.”
But his armor bearer would not, for he was terrified. Therefore Saul took his sword and fell on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he likewise fell on his sword and died.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Saul died with his three sons; and all his house died together.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the men of Israel who were in the valley saw that they fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their cities, and fled; and the Philistines came and lived in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next day, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stripped him and took his head and his armor, then sent into the land of the Philistines all around to carry the news to their idols and to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They put his armor in the house of their gods, and fastened his head in the house of Dagon.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all Jabesh Gilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul,
speaker: Narrator

text: all the valiant men arose and took away the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons, and brought them to Jabesh, and buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh, and fasted seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Saul died for his trespass which he committed against Yahweh, because of Yahweh’s word, which he didn’t keep, and also because he asked counsel of one who had a familiar spirit, to inquire,
speaker: Narrator

text: and didn’t inquire of Yahweh. Therefore he killed him, and turned the kingdom over to David the son of Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all Israel gathered themselves to David to Hebron, saying, “Behold, we are your bone and your flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: In times past, even when Saul was king, it was you who led out and brought in Israel. Yahweh your God said to you, ‘You shall be shepherd of my people Israel, and you shall be prince over my people Israel.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the elders of Israel came to the king to Hebron; and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before Yahweh. They anointed David king over Israel, according to Yahweh’s word by Samuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David and all Israel went to Jerusalem (also called Jebus); and the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, were there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The inhabitants of Jebus said to David, “You will not come in here!” Nevertheless David took the stronghold of Zion. The same is David’s city.
speaker: Narrator

text: David had said, “Whoever strikes the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain.” Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first, and was made chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: David lived in the stronghold; therefore they called it David’s city.
speaker: Narrator

text: He built the city all around, from Millo even around; and Joab repaired the rest of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: David grew greater and greater, for Yahweh of Armies was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the chief of the mighty men whom David had, who showed themselves strong with him in his kingdom, together with all Israel, to make him king, according to Yahweh’s word concerning Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the number of the mighty men whom David had: Jashobeam, the son of a Hachmonite, the chief of the thirty; he lifted up his spear against three hundred and killed them at one time.
speaker: Narrator

text: After him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was with David at Pasdammim, and there the Philistines were gathered together to battle, where there was a plot of ground full of barley; and the people fled from before the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stood in the middle of the plot, defended it, and killed the Philistines; and Yahweh saved them by a great victory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three of the thirty chief men went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam; and the army of the Philistines were encamped in the valley of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was then in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was in Bethlehem at that time.
speaker: Narrator

text: David longed, and said, “Oh, that someone would give me water to drink from the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The three broke through the army of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Bethlehem that was by the gate, took it, and brought it to David; but David would not drink any of it, but poured it out to Yahweh,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “My God forbid me, that I should do this! Shall I drink the blood of these men who have put their lives in jeopardy?” For they risked their lives to bring it. Therefore he would not drink it. The three mighty men did these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishai, the brother of Joab, was chief of the three; for he lifted up his spear against three hundred and killed them, and had a name among the three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the three, he was more honorable than the two, and was made their captain; however he wasn’t included in the three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab. He also went down and killed a lion in the middle of a pit on a snowy day.
speaker: Narrator

text: He killed an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits high. In the Egyptian’s hand was a spear like a weaver’s beam; and he went down to him with a staff, plucked the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and killed him with his own spear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada did these things and had a name among the three mighty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he was more honorable than the thirty, but he didn’t attain to the three; and David set him over his guard.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mighty men of the armies also include Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hurai of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shagee the Hararite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Hagri,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite (the armor bearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah),
speaker: Narrator

text: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite (a chief of the Reubenites), and thirty with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hanan the son of Maacah, Joshaphat the Mithnite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jediael the son of Shimri, and Joha his brother, the Tizite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliel the Mahavite, and Jeribai, and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliel, Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are those who came to David to Ziklag while he was a fugitive from Saul the son of Kish. They were among the mighty men, his helpers in war.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were armed with bows, and could use both the right hand and the left in slinging stones and in shooting arrows from the bow. They were of Saul’s relatives of the tribe of Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; Jeziel and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth; Beracah; Jehu the Anathothite;
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the thirty and a leader of the thirty; Jeremiah; Jahaziel; Johanan; Jozabad the Gederathite;
speaker: Narrator

text: Eluzai; Jerimoth; Bealiah; Shemariah; Shephatiah the Haruphite;
speaker: Narrator

text: Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, and Jashobeam, the Korahites;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Joelah and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some Gadites joined David in the stronghold in the wilderness, mighty men of valor, men trained for war, who could handle shield and spear; whose faces were like the faces of lions, and they were as swift as the gazelles on the mountains:
speaker: Narrator

text: Ezer the chief, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeremiah the tenth, and Machbannai the eleventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: These of the sons of Gad were captains of the army. He who was least was equal to one hundred, and the greatest to one thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are those who went over the Jordan in the first month, when it had overflowed all its banks; and they put to flight all who lived in the valleys, both toward the east and toward the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the children of Benjamin and Judah came to the stronghold to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: David went out to meet them, and answered them, “If you have come peaceably to me to help me, my heart will be united with you; but if you have come to betray me to my adversaries, since there is no wrong in my hands, may the God of our fathers see this and rebuke it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Spirit came on Amasai, who was chief of the thirty, and he said, “We are yours, David, and on your side, you son of Jesse. Peace, peace be to you, and peace be to your helpers; for your God helps you.” Then David received them and made them captains of the band.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of Manasseh also joined David when he came with the Philistines against Saul to battle, but they didn’t help them, for the lords of the Philistines sent him away after consultation, saying, “He will desert to his master Saul to the jeopardy of our heads.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As he went to Ziklag, some from Manasseh joined him: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, captains of thousands who were of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: They helped David against the band of raiders, for they were all mighty men of valor and were captains in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: For from day to day men came to David to help him, until there was a great army, like God’s army.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the numbers of the heads of those who were armed for war, who came to David to Hebron to turn the kingdom of Saul to him, according to Yahweh’s word.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Judah who bore shield and spear were six thousand eight hundred, armed for war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the children of Simeon, mighty men of valor for the war: seven thousand one hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the children of Levi: four thousand six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehoiada was the leader of the household of Aaron; and with him were three thousand seven hundred,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zadok, a young man mighty of valor, and of his father’s house twenty-two captains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the children of Benjamin, Saul’s relatives: three thousand, for until then, the greatest part of them had kept their allegiance to Saul’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the children of Ephraim: twenty thousand eight hundred, mighty men of valor, famous men in their fathers’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the half-tribe of Manasseh: eighteen thousand, who were mentioned by name, to come and make David king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the children of Issachar, men who had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do, their heads were two hundred; and all their brothers were at their command.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Zebulun, such as were able to go out in the army, who could set the battle in array with all kinds of instruments of war: fifty thousand who could command and were not of double heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Naphtali: one thousand captains, and with them with shield and spear thirty-seven thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Danites who could set the battle in array: twenty-eight thousand six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Asher, such as were able to go out in the army, who could set the battle in array: forty thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the other side of the Jordan, of the Reubenites, the Gadites, and of the half-tribe of Manasseh, with all kinds of instruments of war for the battle: one hundred twenty thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were men of war who could order the battle array, and came with a perfect heart to Hebron to make David king over all Israel; and all the rest also of Israel were of one heart to make David king.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were there with David three days, eating and drinking; for their brothers had supplied provisions for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover those who were near to them, as far as Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali, brought bread on donkeys, on camels, on mules, and on oxen: supplies of flour, cakes of figs, clusters of raisins, wine, oil, cattle, and sheep in abundance; for there was joy in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David consulted with the captains of thousands and of hundreds, even with every leader.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to all the assembly of Israel, “If it seems good to you, and if it is of Yahweh our God, let’s send word everywhere to our brothers who are left in all the land of Israel, with whom the priests and Levites are in their cities that have pasture lands, that they may gather themselves to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also, let’s bring the ark of our God back to us again, for we didn’t seek it in the days of Saul.”
speaker: Narrator

text: All the assembly said that they would do so, for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David assembled all Israel together, from the Shihor River of Egypt even to the entrance of Hamath, to bring God’s ark from Kiriath Jearim.
speaker: Narrator

text: David went up with all Israel to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath Jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up from there God Yahweh’s ark that sits above the cherubim, that is called by the Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: They carried God’s ark on a new cart, and brought it out of Abinadab’s house; and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.
speaker: Narrator

text: David and all Israel played before God with all their might, even with songs, with harps, with stringed instruments, with tambourines, with cymbals, and with trumpets.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to Chidon’s threshing floor, Uzza put out his hand to hold the ark, for the oxen stumbled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh’s anger burned against Uzza, and he struck him because he put his hand on the ark; and he died there before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was displeased, because Yahweh had broken out against Uzza. He called that place Perez Uzza, to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was afraid of God that day, saying, “How can I bring God’s ark home to me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So David didn’t move the ark with him into David’s city, but carried it aside into Obed-Edom the Gittite’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: God’s ark remained with the family of Obed-Edom in his house three months; and Yahweh blessed Obed-Edom’s house and all that he had.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David with cedar trees, masons, and carpenters, to build him a house.
speaker: Narrator

text: David perceived that Yahweh had established him king over Israel, for his kingdom was highly exalted, for his people Israel’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: David took more wives in Jerusalem, and David became the father of more sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the children whom he had in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Philistines heard that David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David; and David heard of it, and went out against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Philistines had come and made a raid in the valley of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text:
David inquired of God, saying, “Shall I go up against the Philistines? Will you deliver them into my hand?”
Yahweh said to him, “Go up; for I will deliver them into your hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they came up to Baal Perazim, and David defeated them there. David said, God has broken my enemies by my hand, like waters breaking out. Therefore they called the name of that place Baal Perazim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They left their gods there; and David gave a command, and they were burned with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Philistines made another raid in the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: David inquired again of God; and God said to him, “You shall not go up after them. Turn away from them, and come on them opposite the mulberry trees.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the mulberry trees, then go out to battle; for God has gone out before you to strike the army of the Philistines.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David did as God commanded him; and they attacked the army of the Philistines from Gibeon even to Gezer.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fame of David went out into all lands; and Yahweh brought the fear of him on all nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: David made himself houses in David’s city; and he prepared a place for God’s ark, and pitched a tent for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said, “No one ought to carry God’s ark but the Levites. For Yahweh has chosen them to carry God’s ark, and to minister to him forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David assembled all Israel at Jerusalem, to bring up Yahweh’s ark to its place, which he had prepared for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: David gathered together the sons of Aaron and the Levites:
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Kohath, Uriel the chief, and his brothers one hundred twenty;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Merari, Asaiah the chief, and his brothers two hundred twenty;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Gershom, Joel the chief, and his brothers one hundred thirty;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the chief, and his brothers two hundred;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Hebron, Eliel the chief, and his brothers eighty;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Uzziel, Amminadab the chief, and his brothers one hundred twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites: for Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to them, “You are the heads of the fathers’ households of the Levites. Sanctify yourselves, both you and your brothers, that you may bring the ark of Yahweh, the God of Israel, up to the place that I have prepared for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For because you didn’t carry it at first, Yahweh our God broke out in anger against us, because we didn’t seek him according to the ordinance.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of Yahweh, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of the Levites bore God’s ark on their shoulders with its poles, as Moses commanded according to Yahweh’s word.
speaker: Narrator

text: David spoke to the chief of the Levites to appoint their brothers as singers with instruments of music, stringed instruments, harps, and cymbals, sounding aloud and lifting up their voices with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brothers, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of the sons of Merari their brothers, Ethan the son of Kushaiah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and with them their brothers of the second rank: Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel, the doorkeepers.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were given cymbals of bronze to sound aloud;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with stringed instruments set to Alamoth;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah, with harps tuned to the eight-stringed lyre, to lead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was over the singing. He taught the singers, because he was skillful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Berechiah and Elkanah were doorkeepers for the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, blew the trumpets before God’s ark; and Obed-Edom and Jehiah were doorkeepers for the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David, the elders of Israel, and the captains over thousands went to bring the ark of Yahweh’s covenant up out of the house of Obed-Edom with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: When God helped the Levites who bore the ark of Yahweh’s covenant, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who bore the ark, the singers, and Chenaniah the choir master with the singers; and David had an ephod of linen on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus all Israel brought the ark of Yahweh’s covenant up with shouting, with sound of the cornet, with trumpets, and with cymbals, sounding aloud with stringed instruments and harps.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the ark of Yahweh’s covenant came to David’s city, Michal the daughter of Saul looked out at the window, and saw king David dancing and playing; and she despised him in her heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought in God’s ark, and set it in the middle of the tent that David had pitched for it; and they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David had finished offering the burnt offering and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in Yahweh’s name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave to everyone of Israel, both man and woman, to everyone a loaf of bread, a portion of meat, and a cake of raisins.
speaker: Narrator

text: He appointed some of the Levites to minister before Yahweh’s ark, and to commemorate, to thank, and to praise Yahweh, the God of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: Asaph the chief, and second to him Zechariah, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel, with stringed instruments and with harps; and Asaph with cymbals, sounding aloud;
speaker: Narrator

text: with Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually, before the ark of the covenant of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then on that day David first ordained giving of thanks to Yahweh by the hand of Asaph and his brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh give thanks to Yahweh.
    Call on his name.
    Make what he has done known among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to him.
    Sing praises to him.
    Tell of all his marvelous works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Glory in his holy name.
    Let the heart of those who seek Yahweh rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek Yahweh and his strength.
    Seek his face forever more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember his marvelous works that he has done,
    his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
you offspring of Israel his servant,
    you children of Jacob, his chosen ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is Yahweh our God.
    His judgments are in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember his covenant forever,
    the word which he commanded to a thousand generations,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the covenant which he made with Abraham,
    his oath to Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He confirmed it to Jacob for a statute,
    and to Israel for an everlasting covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying, “I will give you the land of Canaan,
    The lot of your inheritance,”
speaker: Narrator

text:
when you were but a few men in number,
    yes, very few, and foreigners in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They went about from nation to nation,
    from one kingdom to another people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He allowed no man to do them wrong.
    Yes, he reproved kings for their sakes,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Don’t touch my anointed ones!
    Do my prophets no harm!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to Yahweh, all the earth!
    Display his salvation from day to day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Declare his glory among the nations,
    and his marvelous works among all the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For great is Yahweh, and greatly to be praised.
    He also is to be feared above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For all the gods of the peoples are idols,
    but Yahweh made the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Honor and majesty are before him.
    Strength and gladness are in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to Yahweh, you families of the peoples,
    ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due to his name.
    Bring an offering, and come before him.
    Worship Yahweh in holy array.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tremble before him, all the earth.
    The world also is established that it can’t be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the heavens be glad,
    and let the earth rejoice!
    Let them say among the nations, “Yahweh reigns!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the sea roar, and its fullness!
    Let the field exult, and all that is in it!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the trees of the forest will sing for joy before Yahweh,
    for he comes to judge the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
    for his loving kindness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Say, “Save us, God of our salvation!
    Gather us together and deliver us from the nations,
    to give thanks to your holy name,
    to triumph in your praise.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel,
    from everlasting even to everlasting.
All the people said, “Amen,” and praised Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he left Asaph and his brothers there before the ark of Yahweh’s covenant, to minister before the ark continually, as every day’s work required;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Obed-Edom with their sixty-eight relatives; Obed-Edom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be doorkeepers;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zadok the priest and his brothers the priests, before Yahweh’s tabernacle in the high place that was at Gibeon,
speaker: Narrator

text: to offer burnt offerings to Yahweh on the altar of burnt offering continually morning and evening, even according to all that is written in Yahweh’s law, which he commanded to Israel;
speaker: Narrator

text: and with them Heman and Jeduthun and the rest who were chosen, who were mentioned by name, to give thanks to Yahweh, because his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text: and with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those that should sound aloud, and with instruments for the songs of God, and the sons of Jeduthun to be at the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people departed, each man to his house; and David returned to bless his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David was living in his house, David said to Nathan the prophet, “Behold, I live in a cedar house, but the ark of Yahweh’s covenant is in a tent.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Nathan said to David, “Do all that is in your heart; for God is with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: That same night, the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go and tell David my servant, ‘Yahweh says, “You shall not build me a house to dwell in;
speaker: Narrator

text: for I have not lived in a house since the day that I brought up Israel to this day, but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tent to another.
speaker: Narrator

text: In all places in which I have walked with all Israel, did I speak a word with any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to be shepherd of my people, saying, ‘Why have you not built me a house of cedar?’”’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now therefore, you shall tell my servant David, ‘Yahweh of Armies says, “I took you from the sheep pen, from following the sheep, to be prince over my people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been with you wherever you have gone, and have cut off all your enemies from before you. I will make you a name like the name of the great ones who are in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in their own place, and be moved no more. The children of wickedness will not waste them any more, as at the first,
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the day that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. I will subdue all your enemies. Moreover I tell you that Yahweh will build you a house.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will happen, when your days are fulfilled that you must go to be with your fathers, that I will set up your offspring after you, who will be of your sons; and I will establish his kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will build me a house, and I will establish his throne forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be his father, and he will be my son. I will not take my loving kindness away from him, as I took it from him who was before you;
speaker: Narrator

text: but I will settle him in my house and in my kingdom forever. His throne will be established forever.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so Nathan spoke to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David the king went in and sat before Yahweh; and he said, “Who am I, Yahweh God, and what is my house, that you have brought me this far?
speaker: Narrator

text: This was a small thing in your eyes, O God, but you have spoken of your servant’s house for a great while to come, and have respected me according to the standard of a man of high degree, Yahweh God.
speaker: Narrator

text: What can David say yet more to you concerning the honor which is done to your servant? For you know your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh, for your servant’s sake, and according to your own heart, you have done all this greatness, to make known all these great things.
speaker: Narrator
