text: Yahweh, there is no one like you, neither is there any God besides you, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: What one nation in the earth is like your people Israel, whom God went to redeem to himself for a people, to make you a name by great and awesome things, in driving out nations from before your people whom you redeemed out of Egypt?
speaker: Narrator

text: For you made your people Israel your own people forever; and you, Yahweh, became their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, Yahweh, let the word that you have spoken concerning your servant, and concerning his house, be established forever, and do as you have spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let your name be established and magnified forever, saying, ‘Yahweh of Armies is the God of Israel, even a God to Israel. The house of David your servant is established before you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For you, my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build him a house. Therefore your servant has found courage to pray before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, Yahweh, you are God, and have promised this good thing to your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it has pleased you to bless the house of your servant, that it may continue forever before you; for you, Yahweh, have blessed, and it is blessed forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, David defeated the Philistines and subdued them, and took Gath and its towns out of the hand of the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: He defeated Moab; and the Moabites became servants to David and brought tribute.
speaker: Narrator

text: David defeated Hadadezer king of Zobah, toward Hamath, as he went to establish his dominion by the river Euphrates.
speaker: Narrator

text: David took from him one thousand chariots, seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen; and David hamstrung all the chariot horses, but reserved of them enough for one hundred chariots.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David struck twenty-two thousand men of the Syrians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus; and the Syrians became servants to David and brought tribute. Yahweh gave victory to David wherever he went.
speaker: Narrator

text: David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Tibhath and from Cun, cities of Hadadezer, David took very much bronze, with which Solomon made the bronze sea, the pillars, and the vessels of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Tou king of Hamath heard that David had struck all the army of Hadadezer king of Zobah,
speaker: Narrator

text: he sent Hadoram his son to King David to greet him and to bless him, because he had fought against Hadadezer and struck him (for Hadadezer had wars with Tou); and he had with him all kinds of vessels of gold and silver and bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: King David also dedicated these to Yahweh, with the silver and the gold that he carried away from all the nations: from Edom, from Moab, from the children of Ammon, from the Philistines, and from Amalek.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover Abishai the son of Zeruiah struck eighteen thousand of the Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put garrisons in Edom; and all the Edomites became servants to David. Yahweh gave victory to David wherever he went.
speaker: Narrator

text: David reigned over all Israel; and he executed justice and righteousness for all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder;
speaker: Narrator

text: Zadok the son of Ahitub and Abimelech the son of Abiathar were priests; Shavsha was scribe;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and the sons of David were chief officials serving the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.”
So David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. David’s servants came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun to comfort him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, “Do you think that David honors your father, in that he has sent comforters to you? Haven’t his servants come to you to search, to overthrow, and to spy out the land?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Hanun took David’s servants, shaved them, and cut off their garments in the middle at their buttocks, and sent them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some people went and told David how the men were treated. He sent to meet them; for the men were greatly humiliated. The king said, “Stay at Jericho until your beards have grown, and then return.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent one thousand talents of silver to hire chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, out of Aram-maacah, and out of Zobah.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they hired for themselves thirty-two thousand chariots, and the king of Maacah with his people, who came and encamped near Medeba. The children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David heard of it, he sent Joab with all the army of the mighty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array at the gate of the city; and the kings who had come were by themselves in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose some of all the choice men of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest of the people he committed into the hand of Abishai his brother; and they put themselves in array against the children of Ammon.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “If the Syrians are too strong for me, then you are to help me; but if the children of Ammon are too strong for you, then I will help you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be courageous, and let’s be strong for our people and for the cities of our God. May Yahweh do that which seems good to him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joab and the people who were with him came near to the front of the Syrians to the battle; and they fled before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians had fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Syrians saw that they were defeated by Israel, they sent messengers and called out the Syrians who were beyond the River, with Shophach the captain of the army of Hadadezer leading them.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was told that, so he gathered all Israel together, passed over the Jordan, came to them, and set the battle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Syrians, they fought with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Syrians fled before Israel; and David killed of the Syrian men seven thousand charioteers and forty thousand footmen, and also killed Shophach the captain of the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the servants of Hadadezer saw that they were defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and served him. The Syrians would not help the children of Ammon any more.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the time of the return of the year, at the time when kings go out, Joab led out the army and wasted the country of the children of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah. But David stayed at Jerusalem. Joab struck Rabbah, and overthrew it.
speaker: Narrator

text: David took the crown of their king from off his head, and found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there were precious stones in it. It was set on David’s head, and he brought very much plunder out of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought out the people who were in it, and had them cut with saws, with iron picks, and with axes. David did so to all the cities of the children of Ammon. Then David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, war arose at Gezer with the Philistines. Then Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, of the sons of the giant; and they were subdued.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again there was war with the Philistines; and Elhanan the son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was again war at Gath, where there was a man of great stature, who had twenty-four fingers and toes, six on each hand and six on each foot; and he also was born to the giant.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea, David’s brother, killed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were born to the giant in Gath; and they fell by the hand of David and by the hand of his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Satan stood up against Israel, and moved David to take a census of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to Joab and to the princes of the people, “Go, count Israel from Beersheba even to Dan; and bring me word, that I may know how many there are.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joab said, “May Yahweh make his people a hundred times as many as they are. But, my lord the king, aren’t they all my lord’s servants? Why does my lord require this thing? Why will he be a cause of guilt to Israel?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless the king’s word prevailed against Joab. Therefore Joab departed and went throughout all Israel, then came to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joab gave the sum of the census of the people to David. All those of Israel were one million one hundred thousand men who drew a sword; and in Judah were four hundred seventy thousand men who drew a sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he didn’t count Levi and Benjamin among them, for the king’s word was abominable to Joab.
speaker: Narrator

text: God was displeased with this thing; therefore he struck Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to God, “I have sinned greatly, in that I have done this thing. But now put away, I beg you, the iniquity of your servant, for I have done very foolishly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh spoke to Gad, David’s seer, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go and speak to David, saying, ‘Yahweh says, “I offer you three things. Choose one of them, that I may do it to you.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Gad came to David and said to him, “Yahweh says, ‘Take your choice:
speaker: Narrator

text: either three years of famine; or three months to be consumed before your foes, while the sword of your enemies overtakes you; or else three days of the sword of Yahweh, even pestilence in the land, and Yahweh’s angel destroying throughout all the borders of Israel. Now therefore consider what answer I shall return to him who sent me.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to Gad, “I am in distress. Let me fall, I pray, into Yahweh’s hand, for his mercies are very great. Don’t let me fall into man’s hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Yahweh sent a pestilence on Israel, and seventy thousand men of Israel fell.
speaker: Narrator

text: God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it. As he was about to destroy, Yahweh saw, and he relented of the disaster, and said to the destroying angel, “It is enough. Now withdraw your hand.” Yahweh’s angel was standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
speaker: Narrator

text:
David lifted up his eyes, and saw Yahweh’s angel standing between earth and the sky, having a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem.
Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell on their faces.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to God, “Isn’t it I who commanded the people to be counted? It is even I who have sinned and done very wickedly; but these sheep, what have they done? Please let your hand, O Yahweh my God, be against me and against my father’s house; but not against your people, that they should be plagued.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Yahweh’s angel commanded Gad to tell David that David should go up and raise an altar to Yahweh on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
speaker: Narrator

text: David went up at the saying of Gad, which he spoke in Yahweh’s name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ornan turned back and saw the angel; and his four sons who were with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat.
speaker: Narrator

text: As David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, and went out of the threshing floor, and bowed himself to David with his face to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said to Ornan, “Sell me the place of this threshing floor, that I may build an altar to Yahweh on it. You shall sell it to me for the full price, that the plague may be stopped from afflicting the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Ornan said to David, “Take it for yourself, and let my lord the king do that which is good in his eyes. Behold, I give the oxen for burnt offerings, and the threshing instruments for wood, and the wheat for the meal offering. I give it all.”
speaker: Narrator

text: King David said to Ornan, “No, but I will most certainly buy it for the full price. For I will not take that which is yours for Yahweh, nor offer a burnt offering that costs me nothing.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So David gave to Ornan six hundred shekels of gold by weight for the place.
speaker: Narrator

text: David built an altar to Yahweh there, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings, and called on Yahweh; and he answered him from the sky by fire on the altar of burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Yahweh commanded the angel, and he put his sword back into its sheath.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time, when David saw that Yahweh had answered him in the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh’s tabernacle, which Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt offering, were at that time in the high place at Gibeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: But David couldn’t go before it to inquire of God, for he was afraid because of the sword of Yahweh’s angel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said, “This is the house of Yahweh God, and this is the altar of burnt offering for Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David gave orders to gather together the foreigners who were in the land of Israel; and he set masons to cut dressed stones to build God’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates and for the couplings, and bronze in abundance without weight,
speaker: Narrator

text: and cedar trees without number, for the Sidonians and the people of Tyre brought cedar trees in abundance to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said, “Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house that is to be built for Yahweh must be exceedingly magnificent, of fame and of glory throughout all countries. I will therefore make preparation for it.” So David prepared abundantly before his death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he called for Solomon his son, and commanded him to build a house for Yahweh, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to Solomon his son, “As for me, it was in my heart to build a house to the name of Yahweh my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Yahweh’s word came to me, saying, ‘You have shed blood abundantly and have made great wars. You shall not build a house to my name, because you have shed much blood on the earth in my sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, a son shall be born to you, who shall be a man of peace. I will give him rest from all his enemies all around; for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness to Israel in his days.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall build a house for my name; and he will be my son, and I will be his father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, my son, may Yahweh be with you and prosper you, and build the house of Yahweh your God, as he has spoken concerning you.
speaker: Narrator

text: May Yahweh give you discretion and understanding, and put you in charge of Israel, so that you may keep the law of Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you will prosper, if you observe to do the statutes and the ordinances which Yahweh gave Moses concerning Israel. Be strong and courageous. Don’t be afraid and don’t be dismayed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, behold, in my affliction I have prepared for Yahweh’s house one hundred thousand talents of gold, one million talents of silver, and bronze and iron without weight; for it is in abundance. I have also prepared timber and stone; and you may add to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are also workmen with you in abundance—cutters and workers of stone and timber, and all kinds of men who are skillful in every kind of work;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the gold, the silver, the bronze, and the iron, there is no number. Arise and be doing, and may Yahweh be with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David also commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Isn’t Yahweh your God with you? Hasn’t he given you rest on every side? For he has delivered the inhabitants of the land into my hand; and the land is subdued before Yahweh and before his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now set your heart and your soul to follow Yahweh your God. Arise therefore, and build the sanctuary of Yahweh God, to bring the ark of Yahweh’s covenant and the holy vessels of God into the house that is to be built for Yahweh’s name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now David was old and full of days; and he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gathered together all the princes of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites were counted from thirty years old and upward; and their number by their polls, man by man, was thirty-eight thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said, “Of these, twenty-four thousand were to oversee the work of Yahweh’s house, six thousand were officers and judges,
speaker: Narrator

text: four thousand were doorkeepers, and four thousand praised Yahweh with the instruments which I made for giving praise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David divided them into divisions according to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Gershonites: Ladan and Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the chief, Zetham, and Joel, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shimei: Shelomoth, Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the heads of the fathers’ households of Ladan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second; but Jeush and Beriah didn’t have many sons; therefore they became a fathers’ house in one reckoning.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses; and Aaron was separated that he should sanctify the most holy things, he and his sons forever, to burn incense before Yahweh, to minister to him, and to bless in his name forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for Moses the man of God, his sons were named among the tribe of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gershom: Shebuel the chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Eliezer was Rehabiah the chief; and Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Izhar: Shelomith the chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Uzziel: Micah the chief, and Isshiah the second.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar died, and had no sons, but daughters only; and their relatives, the sons of Kish, took them as wives.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Levi after their fathers’ houses, even the heads of the fathers’ houses of those who were counted individually, in the number of names by their polls, who did the work for the service of Yahweh’s house, from twenty years old and upward.
speaker: Narrator

text: For David said, “Yahweh, the God of Israel, has given rest to his people; and he dwells in Jerusalem forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Levites will no longer need to carry the tabernacle and all its vessels for its service.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For by the last words of David the sons of Levi were counted, from twenty years old and upward.
speaker: Narrator

text: For their duty was to wait on the sons of Aaron for the service of Yahweh’s house—in the courts, in the rooms, and in the purifying of all holy things, even the work of the service of God’s house;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the show bread also, and for the fine flour for a meal offering, whether of unleavened wafers, or of that which is baked in the pan, or of that which is soaked, and for all measurements of quantity and size;
speaker: Narrator

text: and to stand every morning to thank and praise Yahweh, and likewise in the evening;
speaker: Narrator

text: and to offer all burnt offerings to Yahweh on the Sabbaths, on the new moons, and on the set feasts, in number according to the ordinance concerning them, continually before Yahweh;
speaker: Narrator

text: and that they should keep the duty of the Tent of Meeting, the duty of the holy place, and the duty of the sons of Aaron their brothers for the service of Yahweh’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the divisions of the sons of Aaron. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children; therefore Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: David, with Zadok of the sons of Eleazar and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, divided them according to their ordering in their service.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were more chief men found of the sons of Eleazar than of the sons of Ithamar; and they were divided like this: of the sons of Eleazar there were sixteen, heads of fathers’ houses; and of the sons of Ithamar, according to their fathers’ houses, eight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they were divided impartially by drawing lots; for there were princes of the sanctuary and princes of God, both of the sons of Eleazar, and of the sons of Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shemaiah the son of Nethanel the scribe, who was of the Levites, wrote them in the presence of the king, the princes, Zadok the priest, Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and the heads of the fathers’ households of the priests and of the Levites; one fathers’ house being taken for Eleazar, and one taken for Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the first lot came out to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
speaker: Narrator

text: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
speaker: Narrator

text: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
speaker: Narrator

text: the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,
speaker: Narrator

text: the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezkel,
speaker: Narrator

text: the twenty-first to Jachin, the twenty-second to Gamul,
speaker: Narrator

text: the twenty-third to Delaiah, and the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was their ordering in their service, to come into Yahweh’s house according to the ordinance given to them by Aaron their father, as Yahweh, the God of Israel, had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the rest of the sons of Levi: of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, Isshiah the chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Izharites, Shelomoth; of the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Uzziel: Micah; of the sons of Micah, Shamir.
speaker: Narrator

text: The brother of Micah: Isshiah; of the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The son of Jaaziah: Beno.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari by Jaaziah: Beno, Shoham, Zaccur, and Ibri.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Kish, the son of Kish: Jerahmeel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites after their fathers’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: These likewise cast lots even as their brothers the sons of Aaron in the presence of David the king, Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of the fathers’ households of the priests and of the Levites, the fathers’ households of the chief even as those of his younger brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, David and the captains of the army set apart for the service certain of the sons of Asaph, of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who were to prophesy with harps, with stringed instruments, and with cymbals. The number of those who did the work according to their service was:
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asharelah. The sons of Asaph were under the hand of Asaph, who prophesied at the order of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hands of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied in giving thanks and praising Yahweh with the harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Heman, the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-Ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were the sons of Heman the king’s seer in the words of God, to lift up the horn. God gave to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were under the hands of their father for song in Yahweh’s house, with cymbals, stringed instruments, and harps, for the service of God’s house: Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman being under the order of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: The number of them, with their brothers who were instructed in singing to Yahweh, even all who were skillful, was two hundred eighty-eight.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cast lots for their offices, all alike, the small as well as the great, the teacher as well as the student.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the first lot came out for Asaph to Joseph; the second to Gedaliah, he and his brothers and sons were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the third to Zaccur, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fourth to Izri, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifth to Nethaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the sixth to Bukkiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the seventh to Jesharelah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the eighth to Jeshaiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the ninth to Mattaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the tenth to Shimei, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the eleventh to Azarel, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the thirteenth, Shubael, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the fourteenth, Mattithiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the fifteenth to Jeremoth, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the sixteenth to Hananiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the seventeenth to Joshbekashah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the eighteenth to Hanani, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the nineteenth to Mallothi, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the twentieth to Eliathah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the twenty-first to Hothir, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the twenty-second to Giddalti, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the twenty-third to Mahazioth, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the twenty-fourth to Romamti-Ezer, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the divisions of the doorkeepers: of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, and Eliehoenai the seventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Obed-Edom had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sacar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, and Peullethai the eighth; for God blessed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sons were also born to Shemaiah his son, who ruled over the house of their father; for they were mighty men of valor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shemaiah: Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, whose relatives were valiant men, Elihu, and Semachiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were of the sons of Obed-Edom with their sons and their brothers, able men in strength for the service: sixty-two of Obed-Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meshelemiah had sons and brothers, eighteen valiant men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Hosah, of the children of Merari, had sons: Shimri the chief (for though he was not the firstborn, yet his father made him chief),
speaker: Narrator

text: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, and Zechariah the fourth. All the sons and brothers of Hosah were thirteen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of these were the divisions of the doorkeepers, even of the chief men, having offices like their brothers, to minister in Yahweh’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cast lots, the small as well as the great, according to their fathers’ houses, for every gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lot eastward fell to Shelemiah. Then for Zechariah his son, a wise counselor, they cast lots; and his lot came out northward.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Obed-Edom southward; and to his sons the storehouse.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Shuppim and Hosah westward, by the gate of Shallecheth, at the causeway that goes up, watchman opposite watchman.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eastward were six Levites, northward four a day, southward four a day, and for the storehouse two and two.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Parbar westward, four at the causeway, and two at Parbar.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the divisions of the doorkeepers; of the sons of the Korahites, and of the sons of Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of God’s house and over the treasures of the dedicated things.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ladan, the sons of the Gershonites belonging to Ladan, the heads of the fathers’ households belonging to Ladan the Gershonite: Jehieli.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jehieli: Zetham, and Joel his brother, over the treasures of Yahweh’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Amramites, of the Izharites, of the Hebronites, of the Uzzielites:
speaker: Narrator

text: Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler over the treasuries.
speaker: Narrator

text: His brothers: of Eliezer, Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zichri his son, and Shelomoth his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: This Shelomoth and his brothers were over all the treasuries of the dedicated things, which David the king, and the heads of the fathers’ households, the captains over thousands and hundreds, and the captains of the army, had dedicated.
speaker: Narrator

text: They dedicated some of the plunder won in battles to repair Yahweh’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that Samuel the seer, Saul the son of Kish, Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah had dedicated, whoever had dedicated anything, it was under the hand of Shelomoth and of his brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were appointed to the outward business over Israel, for officers and judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brothers, one thousand seven hundred men of valor, had the oversight of Israel beyond the Jordan westward, for all the business of Yahweh and for the service of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Hebronites, Jerijah was the chief of the Hebronites, according to their generations by fathers’ households. They were sought for in the fortieth year of the reign of David, and mighty men of valor were found among them at Jazer of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: His relatives, men of valor, were two thousand seven hundred, heads of fathers’ households, whom King David made overseers over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of the Manassites, for every matter pertaining to God and for the affairs of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the children of Israel after their number, the heads of fathers’ households and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and their officers who served the king in any matter of the divisions which came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year—of every division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the first division for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel. In his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was of the children of Perez, the chief of all the captains of the army for the first month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the division of the second month was Dodai the Ahohite and his division, and Mikloth the ruler; and in his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The third captain of the army for the third month was Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada the chief priest. In his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is that Benaiah who was the mighty man of the thirty and over the thirty. Of his division was Ammizabad his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fourth captain for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him. In his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fifth captain for the fifth month was Shamhuth the Izrahite. In his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sixth captain for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite. In his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seventh captain for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, of the children of Ephraim. In his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eighth captain for the eighth month was Sibbecai the Hushathite, of the Zerahites. In his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ninth captain for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anathothite, of the Benjamites. In his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tenth captain for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zerahites. In his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eleventh captain for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the children of Ephraim. In his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The twelfth captain for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel. In his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore over the tribes of Israel: of the Reubenites, Eliezer the son of Zichri was the ruler; of the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maacah;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Levi, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel; of Aaron, Zadok;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Judah, Elihu, one of the brothers of David; of Issachar, Omri the son of Michael;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah; of Naphtali, Jeremoth the son of Azriel;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the children of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah; of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah; of Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham. These were the captains of the tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But David didn’t take the number of them from twenty years old and under, because Yahweh had said he would increase Israel like the stars of the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joab the son of Zeruiah began to take a census, but didn’t finish; and wrath came on Israel for this. The number wasn’t put into the account in the chronicles of King David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the king’s treasures was Azmaveth the son of Adiel. Over the treasures in the fields, in the cities, in the villages, and in the towers was Jonathan the son of Uzziah;
speaker: Narrator

text: Over those who did the work of the field for tillage of the ground was Ezri the son of Chelub.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the vineyards was Shimei the Ramathite. Over the increase of the vineyards for the wine cellars was Zabdi the Shiphmite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that were in the lowland was Baal Hanan the Gederite. Over the cellars of oil was Joash.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the herds that fed in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite. Over the herds that were in the valleys was Shaphat the son of Adlai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the camels was Obil the Ishmaelite. Over the donkeys was Jehdeiah the Meronothite. Over the flocks was Jaziz the Hagrite.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were the rulers of the property which was King David’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Jonathan, David’s uncle, was a counselor, a man of understanding, and a scribe. Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was with the king’s sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahithophel was the king’s counselor. Hushai the Archite was the king’s friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar. Joab was the captain of the king’s army.
speaker: Narrator

text: David assembled all the princes of Israel, the princes of the tribes, the captains of the companies who served the king by division, the captains of thousands, the captains of hundreds, and the rulers over all the substance and possessions of the king and of his sons, with the officers and the mighty men, even all the mighty men of valor, to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David the king stood up on his feet and said, “Hear me, my brothers and my people! As for me, it was in my heart to build a house of rest for the ark of Yahweh’s covenant, and for the footstool of our God; and I had prepared for the building.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God said to me, ‘You shall not build a house for my name, because you are a man of war and have shed blood.’
speaker: Narrator

text: However Yahweh, the God of Israel, chose me out of all the house of my father to be king over Israel forever. For he has chosen Judah to be prince; and in the house of Judah, the house of my father; and among the sons of my father he took pleasure in me to make me king over all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of all my sons (for Yahweh has given me many sons), he has chosen Solomon my son to sit on the throne of Yahweh’s kingdom over Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to me, ‘Solomon, your son, shall build my house and my courts; for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will establish his kingdom forever if he continues to do my commandments and my ordinances, as it is today.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, in the sight of all Israel, Yahweh’s assembly, and in the audience of our God, observe and seek out all the commandments of Yahweh your God, that you may possess this good land, and leave it for an inheritance to your children after you forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: You, Solomon my son, know the God of your father, and serve him with a perfect heart and with a willing mind; for Yahweh searches all hearts, and understands all the imaginations of the thoughts. If you seek him, he will be found by you; but if you forsake him, he will cast you off forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed now, for Yahweh has chosen you to build a house for the sanctuary. Be strong, and do it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David gave to Solomon his son the plans for the porch of the temple, for its houses, for its treasuries, for its upper rooms, for its inner rooms, for the place of the mercy seat;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the plans of all that he had by the Spirit, for the courts of Yahweh’s house, for all the surrounding rooms, for the treasuries of God’s house, and for the treasuries of the dedicated things;
speaker: Narrator

text: also for the divisions of the priests and the Levites, for all the work of the service of Yahweh’s house, and for all the vessels of service in Yahweh’s house—
speaker: Narrator

text: of gold by weight for the gold for all vessels of every kind of service, for all the vessels of silver by weight, for all vessels of every kind of service;
speaker: Narrator

text: by weight also for the lamp stands of gold, and for its lamps, of gold, by weight for every lamp stand and for its lamps; and for the lamp stands of silver, by weight for every lamp stand and for its lamps, according to the use of every lamp stand;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the gold by weight for the tables of show bread, for every table; and silver for the tables of silver;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the forks, the basins, and the cups, of pure gold; and for the golden bowls by weight for every bowl; and for the silver bowls by weight for every bowl;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the altar of incense, refined gold by weight; and gold for the plans for the chariot, and the cherubim that spread out and cover the ark of Yahweh’s covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: “All this”, David said, “I have been made to understand in writing from Yahweh’s hand, even all the works of this pattern.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to Solomon his son, “Be strong and courageous, and do it. Don’t be afraid, nor be dismayed, for Yahweh God, even my God, is with you. He will not fail you nor forsake you, until all the work for the service of Yahweh’s house is finished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, there are the divisions of the priests and the Levites for all the service of God’s house. Every willing man who has skill for any kind of service shall be with you in all kinds of work. Also the captains and all the people will be entirely at your command.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David the king said to all the assembly, “Solomon my son, whom alone God has chosen, is yet young and tender, and the work is great; for the palace is not for man, but for Yahweh God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for the things of gold, the silver for the things of silver, the bronze for the things of bronze, iron for the things of iron, and wood for the things of wood, also onyx stones, stones to be set, stones for inlaid work of various colors, all kinds of precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text: In addition, because I have set my affection on the house of my God, since I have a treasure of my own of gold and silver, I give it to the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house:
speaker: Narrator

text: even three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, with which to overlay the walls of the houses;
speaker: Narrator

text: of gold for the things of gold, and of silver for the things of silver, and for all kinds of work to be made by the hands of artisans. Who then offers willingly to consecrate himself today to Yahweh?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the princes of the fathers’ households, and the princes of the tribes of Israel, and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the rulers over the king’s work, offered willingly;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they gave for the service of God’s house of gold five thousand talents and ten thousand darics, of silver ten thousand talents, of bronze eighteen thousand talents, and of iron one hundred thousand talents.
speaker: Narrator

text: People with whom precious stones were found gave them to the treasure of Yahweh’s house, under the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people rejoiced, because they offered willingly, because with a perfect heart they offered willingly to Yahweh; and David the king also rejoiced with great joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore David blessed Yahweh before all the assembly; and David said, “You are blessed, Yahweh, the God of Israel our father, forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yours, Yahweh, is the greatness, the power, the glory, the victory, and the majesty! For all that is in the heavens and in the earth is yours. Yours is the kingdom, Yahweh, and you are exalted as head above all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Both riches and honor come from you, and you rule over all! In your hand is power and might! It is in your hand to make great, and to give strength to all!
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, our God, we thank you and praise your glorious name.
speaker: Narrator

text: But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly as this? For all things come from you, and we have given you of your own.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are strangers before you and foreigners, as all our fathers were. Our days on the earth are as a shadow, and there is no remaining.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh our God, all this store that we have prepared to build you a house for your holy name comes from your hand, and is all your own.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know also, my God, that you try the heart and have pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of my heart I have willingly offered all these things. Now I have seen with joy your people, who are present here, offer willingly to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, our fathers, keep this desire forever in the thoughts of the heart of your people, and prepare their heart for you;
speaker: Narrator

text: and give to Solomon my son a perfect heart, to keep your commandments, your testimonies, and your statutes, and to do all these things, and to build the palace, for which I have made provision.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then David said to all the assembly, “Now bless Yahweh your God!”
All the assembly blessed Yahweh, the God of their fathers, and bowed down their heads and prostrated themselves before Yahweh and the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: They sacrificed sacrifices to Yahweh and offered burnt offerings to Yahweh on the next day after that day, even one thousand bulls, one thousand rams, and one thousand lambs, with their drink offerings and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and ate and drank before Yahweh on that day with great gladness. They made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and anointed him before Yahweh to be prince, and Zadok to be priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon sat on the throne of Yahweh as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel obeyed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the princes, the mighty men, and also all of the sons of King David submitted themselves to Solomon the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel, and gave to him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The time that he reigned over Israel was forty years; he reigned seven years in Hebron, and he reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: He died at a good old age, full of days, riches, and honor; and Solomon his son reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the acts of David the king, first and last, behold, they are written in the history of Samuel the seer, and in the history of Nathan the prophet, and in the history of Gad the seer,
speaker: Narrator

text: with all his reign and his might, and the events that involved him, Israel, and all the kingdoms of the lands.
speaker: Narrator
